title: Bookmarks are saving but never show up in my bookmarks bar folders?
content:
Bookmarks are saving but never show up in my bookmarks bar folders?

  • I have tried to uninstall and reinstall but still same problem. And yes I did a hard delete of all installation files in users - app data..
  • I have checked the read only is not selected in the "places.sqlite", and even deleted it to force a new one, still didn't help.
  • I have also deleted the "xulstore.json" file and that also did not help.
  • I have reset in safe mode to default setting but that also didn't help.

Does anyone please know how to fix this very annoying problem?

Please I really don't want to go back to Chrome but if that's the only reliable browser without so many downsides (apart from privacy) then I don't see any other option if I can't fix this asap.

thank you.

title: Messaggio strano
content:
Mentre navigavo è apparso su tutte le schede questo messaggio:

Ci scusiamo per l’interruzione, ma c’è una cosa da fare prima di proseguire con la navigazione. Un aggiornamento di Firefox è appena stato installato in background. Fai clic su Riavvia Firefox per completare l’installazione. Tutte le pagine, finestre e schede aperte verranno automaticamente ripristinate al riavvio, così potrai riprendere velocemente dal punto in cui ti trovavi. - Sono stato poi dirottato su questa pagina: https://www.mozilla.org/it/firefox/97.0/whatsnew/?oldversion=96.0.3

È legittimo? Non potevo andare avanti con la navigazione se non cliccavo su riavvia.


11-02-2022 circa le GMT+1 17:39
creator: jacopotore

title: Firefox does not honour the printer marked as "default"
content: It would be great if could be possible to instruct Firefox to honour the printer marked as "default" in Windows and use it regardless of what printer was used last time. Now, when one selects Ctrl+P (Print), the last used printer is selected. If there are \\1.2.3.4\sambasharedprinters in Windows printer list and such shared printer was used last time and Ctrl+P is this time issued outside (usually local) network from where this shared printer is only accessible, it can take pretty long time to display Print Preview, because Windows tries to connect to the (last used) network shared printer, which cannot be accessed, thus we are waiting for timeout to happen. Only then one can choose the correct printer.

title: İndirilen Dosyanın Ne Yapılacağına Dair Ayarlar Sıfırlanıyor

Merhabalar,

Sürekli kullandığım bir indirme dosyası ile ilgili yapmış olduğum ayarlama her defasında sıfırlanarak her indirme için ne yapılacağı soruluyor. İndirilmiş dosyanın otomatik olarak seçtiğim uygulama ile açılmasını tercih ediyordum ve uzunca bir süredir firefox bu ayarlamamı dikkate alarak bana soru yöneltmiyordu. Ancak son günlerde belirttiğim dosya uzantısına yönelik her seferinde ne yapılacağını sormaya ve yaptığım ayarı sıfırlamaya başladı.

Destekleriniz için şimdiden teşekkür eder, iyi çalışmalar dilerim.

title: Date Failed / Add-ons Update Failed
content:
I seem to have a problem with the dates in my browser. This has caused the weAutoPagerize add-on to stop working properly. This add-on to connects to a database to update itself. The problem, as the attached image indicates, is that my browser tells the add-on that the date is 12/31/1969, which means that it cannot be updated.

I've also tried the uAutoPagerize add-on, which uses the same database, and has the same problem.

It seems this problem originated when I had to restore my system. However, I already checked the date and time on my computer, and they are correct. It should be noted that this problem only occurs in my portable Firefox. In my desktop version any of the two add-on mentioned above work normally.

What could I do to fix this problem?

Thank you for your answers.

creator: charvat.k

title: Firefox browser won't start up no matter what I do.
content:
I've had this browser installed on my computer for about a year. It is worth noting that, all of the browsers worked perfectly fine before. However, after roughly 3 weeks of regularly seeing that all of the browsers on my Windows 10 PC (Opera, Firefox, Tor) except Chrome browser don't seem to start up. When I run Firefox.exe, it opens for a fraction of a second, displays a text box, and then closes. I tried recording my screen to understand what's written more clearly, and it said "Profile Missing". But not the familiar profile missing error. this one closes immediately, and with no text, only the title. It is also important to mention that all of the files associated with the browser also won't open, except helper.exe. For example, this command "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe" -P to open the profile manager will show the same error.

Things I tried:

1. Refreshing the browser. 2. Uninstalling and reinstalling. 3. Removing the appdata profiles folder. 4. Installing other versions of Firefox. 5. Scanning for malware with 3 different Antivirus programs.

And so far non of these methods worked. I would like to get an answer on how to fix this. Thanks.

title: somethingsdfsdf
content:
Why is this so temperamental: when opening fresh Firefox, it opens with a different page EVERY TIME???

Sometimes it opens with my Homepage, which I have set up deliberately and purposefully to open with my Homepage, which is DuckDuckGo. That’s why I set it up: to open with it every time I open Firefox. To have this certainty. I want it to open with my home page EVERY TIME, not just randomly.

Sometimes it opens with my Homepage, most of the time it does not.

Sometimes it opens with this annoying message how it cannot open previous sessions – I never asked it to open previous sessions!

Sometimes it indeed opens with a page from my last session – I don’t want it to open my previous session!

Sometimes it opens with just a standard “new tab” page – I never told it that either.

What is the problem with opening the Homepage EVERY TIME I start Firefox?

Does Firefox have any concept of how extremely annoying this is?

From the attached photo, what exactly is required here, other than entering the page I want for the Homepage???

title: How often do you use the Next/Previous thread links?
content: A problem has been identified with the next and previous thread links. Links to threads have to be accompanied by the topic offset parameter in order for them to work, which is annoying because then threads won't be seen as visited. If we want to resolve the problem, we can either fix it or simply remove the next and previous features (which would be easier). Is this feature used by anyone?

title: Block due to security issue
content:
I have recently been blocked from down loading info from what has always been a safe site. It is the PEOPLES MAGAZINE ROYALS website. I receive the following message:

'''''' Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue

Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to l.mail.people.com because this website requires a secure connection. bold text What can you do about it?

l.mail.people.com has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You can’t add an exception to visit this site.

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it. You can notify the website’s administrator about the problem.


This came from: 

People Royals <people@mail.people.com>

Unsubscribe To:stmitchell20042004@yahoo.com People Magazine people.com

Can you help me ascertain what is blocking my access to the articles from this website. It indicates a security problem.

title: Can't sync from OSX 10.14 to new OSX 12.2.1 computer
content:
Among the many combinations I've tried: login on old computer, click "sync now" (to push most recent version of everything I want), launch FF on new computer, sign in, click "sync now". Nothing visibly changes on the new machine (no new tabs open), but I can see "recent bookmarks", what either most or all of the stored bookmarks, and what appears to be most but not all of the browsing history. What's needed to restore tabs?

This directory is empty: Index of file:///Users/buggy/Library/Application Support/Firefox/Profiles/6vc9xd36.default-release/weave/logs/

FF version 97.0 on both machines.

I also want to make sure I understand this process. I have dozens of tabs and thousands of bookmarks on the old machine (longtime fan, first time caller). When I launch FF for the first time on the new machine, login, and click "sync now", what is getting written to the server? The SUM of the tabs on the new machine (a half dozen "why doesn't sync work" windows) and the old machine, OR just the tabs on the new machine, as it is the most recently logged in and sync'd?

Thank you for any help you can offer.

title: Firefox Release 97 8th Feb Completely Broken on My System
content:
Long story short, today I received v97. Firefox would no longer open websites. Settings would not open. about:config would not open. Tried killing my profiles. Complete clean installs. None of it worked. Something is 100% wrong with v97, at least for my system. I can install 94 no problem. 96.0.3 no problem. As soon as 97 hits, everything breaks.

I love firefox and would love to troubleshoot the issue, but it's not possible. Most of the time, v97 won't even open, so launching the troubleshooter mode is impossible. And if it does open, selecting troubleshooter results in a crash.

This report also contains technical information about the state of the application when it crashed.
creator: matthewjmatthiesen

title: print.save_print_settings=false not working in v97.0
content: I don't want Firefox to remember the last-used printer. As of v97.0 the printer comes up as the last one I used. I have print.save_print_settings=false. Is it broken?
creator: vesfatica

title: Firefox not loading or opening after uninstalling and removing everything
content: Firefox won't open so I went and uninstalled it and reinstalled it and it won't load anything and is just stuck on the white screen with the address bar. My firefox account works with my phone and other laptop, so I do not know what the issue is.
creator: wfmikitin

title: Why is Firefox not honoring my SSL website certificate.
content:
Why is Firefox not honoring my SSL certificate. GoDaddy is telling us everything is set up correctly. Firefox seems to be the only browser not working. The timeclock on my MacBook pro is correct and I am using the most current OS.

Thanks!
creator: drmary85
